name: Avoid unreferenced Files
description:
This rule searches for C files that are not referenced. 

Note: A file is considered as unreferenced if it does not contain any called function nor the main() function.
output:
Associated to each C file with violations, the Quality Rule provides:
- File name
rationale:
Unreferenced code may be the symptom of Dead Code. Dead Code must be avoided as it makes source code less readable and increases the cost of the software maintenance.

Warning:
Unreferenced code can also be the symptoms of missing code (code not included in the source code analysis) and / or can be the symptom of use of polymorphism.
The intensive use of polymorphism can make the application easier to change but much more difficult to test, debug and stabilize.
remediation: Check if the artifact is truly unnecessary. If not, then remove it from the project.

qualityStandards.name: Unreachable Named Callable or Method Control Element
